eg.console

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.console.Console

  • public class Console
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the console with a text area and buttons for adding actions to run commands.

    Class can have an unlocked, an unlocked active or a locked state. Setting the 'unlocked' flag is required to use this methods that access the text area. Otherwise these methods throw an exception. Active means that the text area is additinally editable and focusable and also that this button for stopping a process is enabled.

    • Method Detail

      • setUnlocked

        public boolean setUnlocked()
        Sets the unlocked state. If the unlocked state is already set a warning dialog is shown.
        Returns:
        true if the unlocked state is not set already, false otherwise

      • setUnlockedAndActive

        public boolean setUnlockedAndActive()
        Sets the unlocked and active state
        Returns:
        true if the unlocked state is not set already, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setUnlocked()

      • keepActive

        public void keepActive(boolean b)
        Keeps or ends the active state but does not change the unlocked state.
        Parameters:
        b - true to keep, false to end the active state

      • appendTextBr

        public void appendTextBr(java.lang.String text)
        Appends the specified text after it is formatted such that it starts with two closing angle brackets and ends with the line separator. This output is intended for predefined status/error messages.
        Parameters:
        text - the text
